steps.instructions: Begin with a simple, low-stakes request to practice FAST in a safe situation.

inputs.label: What small request will you make?
inputs.placeholder: Choose something simple like asking for help with a task, requesting a small favor, or expressing a minor preference..

inputs.label: What happened when you made this request?
inputs.placeholder: Describe the outcome. How did the other person respond? How did you feel?

inputs.label: Reflection: What worked? What would you try differently?
inputs.placeholder: How well did you use FAST? What felt natural? What was challenging?

steps.instructions: Now practice with a more challenging boundary-setting situation.

inputs.label: What bigger situation will you address?
inputs.placeholder: Describe a more challenging situation where you need to set boundaries or make a difficult request...

inputs.label: Practice out loud (role-play, mirror, or recording)
inputs.placeholder: How did you practice? What did you notice about your tone, confidence, or body language?

inputs.label: How did this bigger challenge go?
inputs.placeholder: If you had the conversation, how did it go? If you haven't yet, how confident do you feel about having it?

inputs.label: What did you learn about using FAST?
inputs.placeholder: What insights did you gain? Which part of FAST felt most natural? Which was most challenging?

inputs.label: Next steps for building FAST skills
inputs.placeholder: What situations will you practice FAST in next? How will you continue building these skills?
